nodes.text: Yes, we are trying to get information about senator Quintus Publius?
Welcome to the Marian Hegemony Senate. Senate working hours are from nine am to fifteen pm, standard Alphard time. If you wish, you can leave a message for your designated magistrate.

Yes, I can't believe this, they transferred me again to the public desk, which seems to always be unattended.

To talk directly to Senator Publius I need to either prove I'm a patrician or get the sponsorship of one.
But if you can't talk to a senator, how can you get one to sponsor you in the first place?

I think that's the whole point, senators don't want to be bothered with plebs, thus all this byzantine bureaucracy just to make it discourage people.

And they don't much like foreigners around these parts nosing around - I've already had a couple of hard looks at me while on the surface of [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAlphard],Alphard]].

branches.responseText: Which only leaves us with Alexander's option.

nodes.text:
Yes, to break into the [[DM.Factions[faction_AlphardTradingCompany],ATC]]'s facilities and get the info we want about both senators named Quintus Publius to sort out this mess about whom exactly is the one we're looking for.

Unfortunately that looks like the only way to clear this confusion.

There's more to it, Darius. 

Alexander has also given us indications of how to gain permanent JumpShip access to the entire [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreRimwardPeriphery],Rimward Periphery]] by stealing the transport codes that Interstellar Expeditions uses.

Now we're talking!

Looks like my boy Alex made good on his promise.

There's a significant risk that the ATC will blame this on the [[DM.Factions[faction_MagistracyOfCanopus],Canopians]] but at the same time I guess it's a way for the Magestrix to send both them and the Marians a lesson.

This shouldn't be required to fulfill our contract, but after the [[DM.Factions[faction_LothianLeague],Lothian]] intel proved wrong, it might be the last option left.

That's good legalese, Darius.

Or we can also give the senator we're currently holding in the brig a shot at sorting out this confusion as he's been asking to for hours.
Not to mention that we might risk losing JumpShip access for free because we might not need to break down the place to use Alexander's codes.

branches.responseText: Very well. Sumire, connect the senator to the bridge.

nodes.text: Connecting to brig feed now, Commander.

I am a Marian senator and the scion of one of the [[DM.Factions[faction_MarianHegemony],Hegemony]]'s most distinguished families!

A patrician will not be held hostage in such unworthy conditions!

branches.responseText: Can you contact senator Quintus Publius?

nodes.text:
Yes, if you mean the other senator, the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLegatus],Legatus]] Quintus Publius.

However, I am sure i can arrange for a much better financial arrangement with your company, if you are now willing to listen to me.

We're not interested in your deal senator, at least for now.

Only if you can contact your namesake senator.
You expose me to my Senate enemies by ordering me to contact senator Publius. Being kept captive means both our lives are at risk since you do not know which one to kill, correct?

branches.responseText: Yes, but we only need to kill one of you.

nodes.text:
That is understandable, so what I am proposing is that, instead of you politically assassinating me by forcing me to contact that impostor for help, instead, I hire you to kill him.

That way your employer would be satisfied, I believe?

Our intel was already bad, so that means that you could also be our intended target, senator.

So if we take both of you out, it will be zero chance of failure.

But you were already acting on faulty intelligence given by them.

Also, I clearly don't match the information so you can argue that your employer gave you faulty data to fulfill your contract.

I hate to say it but he might have a point, Commander.

We would also be murdering a civilian.

Darius, but what if the intel is right, only the image is wrong? 

Then we would be killing the wrong target by going after the other senator.

branches.responseText: <color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Contact Legatus Publius.]</color> Senator, please give us the codes to contact your namesake. Now.
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Kill Legatus Publius.]</color> Senator Quintus Publius, how do you propose to kill your namesake?
<color=#85DBF6FF>[Story Decision: Release Senator Publius.]</color> We did our job of assaulting the villa and found our target there.

nodes.text: Very well...

Now I'm wondering what the deal is between both of them, considering what we already know of the Legatus and now this senator.

Maybe our employers want both of them but got the Lothian intel wrong.

branches.responseText: Too late to have remembered that now, Yang.

nodes.text:
I have access to the senators' private agenda, when the Senate is not in session.

We can use that information to plot an ambush.
Wait, you have the wrong senator!

It just took calling one specific number... simple as that, as long as you know which one.

Legatus Publius, senator Quintus Publius wishes to speak to you from our brig.

What?!

What mess have you gotten yourself into now, nephew????
Uncle! I can assure you that this is all a case of mistaken identity...
Oh, but you can be damn sure it is! From the recipe list served at your latest baccanalia, it's clear you couldn't keep your hands out of the ATC's pockets.

Even the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreImperator],Imperator]] knew about it, as well as most of the Senate, uncle, this is of little matter to them.

Now, could you please just order these mercenaries to release me?

Be quiet you fool, before you reveal more than you already have.

Now, Commander, I thank you for bringing this matter to me and I wish we could have seen each other again in nicer circumstances but there's still the issue of your current contract.

branches.responseText: We were ordered to kill senator Quintus Marius Publius.

nodes.text: And there's two of them, although we're not blood related since I was adopted into the Publii family when I became a senator by young Marcus' biological grandfather. But such an order to assassinate a patrician [[DM.Factions[faction_MarianHegemony],Marian]] magistrate like any of us could only have come from the top [[DM.Factions[faction_MagistracyOfCanopus],Canopian]] leadership.

The intel we got is unclear, the data identifies your nephew but the holovid image is of you, Legatus.

So we decided to contact you before we killed the wrong Quintus Publius.

You were wise to be prudent and do not worry, I'll contact Lady [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreAnaMariaCentrella],Ana Maria Centrella]] directly and clear this issue of your contract with her.

Despite the state of affairs between our two nations, we keep unofficial channels open and it will be better not to further escalate this issue with unnecessary bloodshed.

Thank you again for your service, Commander.

Is there anything more I can do for you?

Actually yes, you could, Legatus Publius.

We have been having issues contacting the [[DM.Factions[faction_AlphardTradingCompany],Alphard Trading Company]]. You wouldn't happen to know anyone inside, would you?
Initiating purge protocol at your order, Commander.

That should make our employer satisfied, Commander.

However, we can't just release the senator and risk him revealing the whole plan to the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreLegatus],Legatus]] or the [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreImperator],Imperator]].

I do not need to leave this DropShip to give you such information, I will just require [[DM.BaseDescriptionDefs[LoreHolovid],holovid]] communications with the local office of the Alphard Trading Company.

Then perhaps you could assist us in another matter regarding the ATC, senator?

As part of us building trust in one another?

branches.responseText: That's an excellent idea, Sumire. Darius, we have an ambush to plan.

nodes.text: [Holovid feed disconnected.]
Ugh, that guy is likely staining his toga robes right now in zero-g.

The senator is clearly a major player and we can't risk getting ourselves into a public assassination affair.

But after all the tricks he tried to pull, he deserved the 'purge' scare.

And now that we're done with the crew pranks, we'll need to salvage something out of this contract, before we release this senator and the Marians are after us.

Alexander's IE codes seem like the only option we still have.

branches.responseText: See what you can do, Dr. Murad.
